intro: Mirabilis froebelii, commonly known as the frost flower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Nyctaginaceae family and is known for its striking, tubular-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink, red, and orange. The plant is typically found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. It is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 1 meter in height, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The flowers open in the evening and remain open throughout the night, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths.
